data.title: Great Beer and Eats!
data.text: This place has a large beer selection and a menu with yummy, interesting pizzas, burgers and other appetizer/snack/salad items. Great place to meet up with somebody and catch a quick, yummy bite to eat. Sports on big screen TV's and live music. A great hang out.

data.title: Just ok, but pricey
data.text:
We come to Redding often, but have never tried this restaurant. The positives, our waitress was very friendly and helpful. Checked on us often, made suggestions and helpful recommendations.  The beer was fine and my wine good.
They offer one choice for white or red wine.... Kendall Jackson Cab or Chardonnay. So basically it is a beer joint. As another review said, there are no chairs, just backless stools. Uncomfortable. Zero atmosphere other than beer joint. 
We all 3 had burgers. The buns were hard and dry. Crumbly when you bit down. I asked for medium rare...yeah, no pink in the burger. I had French fries, the others had tater tots. They were tater tots, nothing wow. 
There are other places in Redding that have much better food. I would recommend those.

data.title: Recommendation
data.text: This place was suggested by our vacation house rental owner! Loved the pizza and appetizers and service was great. The fried pickles! Yum! Would definitely return if we vacation in Redding again.

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Walking distance from Thunderbird Lodge. Good food (burgers, pizza, wraps) and local beers. Would go again.

data.title: Dirty
data.text: Great place if you like greasy food in a dirty atmosphere. Went here for dinner with my wife hoping for a good meal in a nice restaurant, but I diffidently picked the wrong place. Maybe I'm just an old fart, but there are no chairs, only backless stoles so I was immediately uncomfortable. Then I looked up at HVAC venting which was covered with dust and almost as dirty as the menu, that was strike 2. I was ready to leave, but reluctantly my wife talked me out of it.  We ordered onion rings and fried zucchini for appetizers, which I could have wrung out and used to change the oil in may car, Strike 3. I ordered a glass of wine and it might as well been served in a jelly jar because I hate to drink wine in a stem less glass. Eat anywhere else.

data.title: Always a favorite spot - a go to
data.text: Always a favorite spot - a go to.  They have great staff and perfect pizza and pesto garlic fries.  Good selection of beers on tap.  They offer live music sometimes.  You can rent out the back room if you wanted for a party or to jam with your band.

data.title: Fun place and great food
data.text:
We went for the burger special, and they
were great! I want to go back for the pizza because everyone I talk to says that it's the best in town. Great bear selection and fun atmosphere ! We will go back and try the pizza, my husband loved loved the peanut butter burger!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: I stopped in for an early dinner and a pint.  They have a nice selection of craft brew on tap.  I ordered the avacado blue burger on the recommendation of the barteneder.   I was not diappointed!  Friendly service

data.title: Great beer and service
data.text: Ordered their draft IPA which was tasty. Husband ordered their lemon pepper wings, which he said were really good. I ordered the boneless wings and tots, which were good but there was WAY too much garlic powder on the tots, it was overpowering. Overall everything was great!

data.title: Good beer selection, good food, good staff!!!!
data.text:
The signage is bad, so you may drive past it a few times before you spot the place, but go around the block again and find it. 

Fun atmosphere, interesting art and signage, dark woods, classic bar room feel.  We were greeted quickly by a bartender that knew her stuff and was efficient.  

About 20 tap handles, does not sound like they keep anything on draft for any length of time, and 2 taps changed while we were there.  Some other offerings available in bottles and cans as well. 

We had the bacon cheese sticks and the French Dip with onion rings, which it appeared that a lot of this was made in house. rather than relying on freezer foods.  Everything was delivered hot and very tasty. 

I would make it a point to stop in Redding to go here again.

data.title: Gotta Try the Maxwell Burger!
data.text: Oh my goodness - the Maxwell Burger is a wonder to behold. It tastes even better than it looks. If you can believe it, this burger has fried jalapenos, bacon, cheese, tomato, lettuce and peanut butter!!!  Yes, I said peanut butter. This might sound like an odd combination, but it works. I have not had any of their other food items, so this review is basically for just one burger - but what a burger! When you go, ask if they have Dogfish Head 90 (or 120) IPA. This was the most incredible beers I've ever had.

data.title: Think "Cheers" with very good burgers
data.text: Took the family to Cheers, ahh, I mean Maxwells for dinner. I was expecting the mellow, classy dinner place of the old Maxwells from many years ago (don't know if it is the same owners), but we walked into a rather busy, noisy, bar/restaurant. We decided to give it a try, even though we had our teenaged kids with us. We all ordered burgers and they were all very good. The kids had fries and tots, which were a better choice than the salads my wife and I had. The salads were small and had too many hot peppers in them for me. They have an excellent selection of craft beers. The service was friendly and prompt. If you're in the mood for a nice local pub/restaurant, try Maxwells in downtown Redding, just don't yell "Norm!!!", when a portly man walks through the door, nobody will laugh.

data.title: Burger
data.text:
Maxwell burger is the stuff food  articles derive flavor from. This burger is awesome! 
Atmosphere so/so therefore the #4 rating

data.title: Quick lunch w/ family
data.text:
Great locally owned pub with fantastic craft beer selection.  Menu was diverse and well balanced with a little something for everyone.

I'd love to visit again when I had more time to work my way through both the food and beer menu a little more thoroughly!

Less than 5 minutes off the highway and well worth the detour!

data.title: Great place to hang with friends
data.text: The hamburgers, especially the avocado, bacon, and blue cheese one are addictive. The pizza is really good while you are there but doesn't save or reheat well. This is a great place to visit with friends.

data.title: great place to hang out with friends
data.text: I like Maxwell's because they have a good craft beer selection on draft and good pub food. It's a fun place to hang out with friends, and a good place to watch the game. So if you're looking for a place to hang out with friends, have some burgers or pizza, and great craft beer on tap, Maxwell's is a good destination.

data.title: fine for beer, horrible for food
data.text: My husband and I went here for lunch, he ordered showings and salad and I ordered a Blt sandwich with tator tots. Nothing fancy...safe bet we thought. Wrong. Hotwings were tiny...I mean like they came off of a quail...and they were overcooked too..so there was about one tiny bite of meat on each piece. Pitiful. Then, when I ordered my Blt..I asked to add avocado which was never put on it...there was no mayo or any sauce on the sandwich, just some butter o  the OUTSIDE of the sandwich....so it was very dry....then my tator tots were overcooked to the point that they had nothing inside them when I bit into them...I ate maybe 3 of them. We should have just refused to eat it and left. We will not ever come back to eat or recommend this place for food. The waitress never even asked us how our food was.

data.title: Good beer and chill atmosphere
data.text: We stayed across the street at the Thunderbird and just wanted a simple beer and burger. This place was our ticket. Food was decent and the atmosphere was nice. The place was busy, but our server was attentive and sweet. We would definitely recommend if you're looking for a place to have a beer and relax.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Very good food, a little pricey, but well worth it. Great place to visit at night and to watch live local bands. Within walking distance (across the street) from the hotel.

data.title: Not impressed
data.text: Got bacon mozzarella sticks and a Hawaiian. The sticks were just not my cup of tea. My husband didn't like them either. The pizza looked really good-but it was really sweet. Like they dumped pineapple juice on it. Was able to cut the sweetness a bit with some marinara. Beer was good. Music must've been coming out of a tiny little speaker or something...sounded really terrible. Hmmm...what else? The service wasn't the best. After waiting for awhile, I finally got menus for us and then someone wandered over to take drink orders. We were just passing through, so won't be back. I would suggest trying a burger or something other than the pizza.
